args: One day, not long before Dragonyule...
Dear Saint Starfall,\nI would like an Arianna, please.\n		Angie
Well this is a pickle. Angie's given me\na letter for Saint Starfall, which is all\nwell and good, but...
What in Ilia's name is an Arianna?!
Here I thought I could just gussy myself\nup as Saint Starfall and give Angie a gift.
But if I can't suss out whatever this\nArianna thing is, Angie might find out that\nSaint Starfall's as real as soft bedrock!
Even so, I can't well ask her directly.
If I let slip that I'M the one out present-\nhunting for her, why, it'd crush her dreams!
No recourse left now but for me to go\naround asking folks who might have a clue.
(Angie's a rokkan girl, so I figured I'd ask\none of her peers. Lazry oughta know.)
And...done. You try making a Yuletree\nornament too, Gauld.
(Bah. Here I thought I could just do a quick\nQ and A. How'd I end up hunkering down to\nhelp Lazry and co. with their work?)
What is it, Gauld? You stopped working.
Keep that fire burning inside! \nWe've got a lot to make, after all!
The castle is too big! I call shenanigans!\nHow many decorations is it gonna take?!
So, in the end, they didn't know\nwhat this all-important Arianna was?
Ha ha ha! What a massive waste\nof time and effort!
My shoulders are stiff as a board after\nhunching over to do all that fiddly work.\nNot every rokkan's a crafter, I'll say that.
Ahhh. Nothing like tea for a tired body.
Your grandfatherly love is an inspiration.\nAlas, I cannot assist in your endeavor.\nI know not what an ＂Arianna＂ is, you see.
Shame. I'd heard you were quite the\nscholar, but I s'pose I expected too much.

My knowledge is rooted primarily in the
realm of things magical. Surely there
must be someone more qualified to help.
A merchant, perhaps?
Hey, you might be on to something there!\nActually, we've got just the gal here at the\ncastle!
I'll go bend her ear a bit.\nSorry to bother ya, Cassandra.
Goodness. Such a fierce-looking man,\nyet so desperate to give from the heart.
Heh. Inspiration strikes. Perhaps I should\nselect a nice gift for the young lad in turn.
Arianna? As it turns out, I HAVE heard\nwhisperings that something by that name\nhas picked up popularity around the castle.
Really?! So what the heck is it?! Spill!
Not so fast. I can't just give away trade\nsecrets for FREE, y'know. What do you say\nto buying this new product I've got?
It's a kind of fruit cake called stollen that's\neaten in a foreign land on Dragonyule.\nBet your little granddaughter'd love it!
Yeah, yeah, twist my arm, why don'tcha?\nFine. I'll buy one.
Oho ho! Much obliged, good sir.\nActually, while you're at it, buy THIS, too.
Oh, c'mon! You're gonna bleed me dry!
All this searching and I've only found out\none thing: Arianna is really popular\nwith the children in the castle.
I oughta confirm with one such kid.\nAha! Perfect, there's Maribelle.
Oh, it's Angie's grandpa.\nYou need something?
Sorry to spring this on ya, but I was\nwondering if you knew about this\nArianna thing that's all the rage.
Finally, someone who'll tell me!\nWhat in Ilia's name is an Arianna?!
Arianna is the name of a BOOK?
Yeah! I love it! And my friend—\nI mean, Angie loves it too!
She read my copy of Arianna and told me\nit totally touched her heart. Sweet, huh?
Oho, so you and Angie are friends?
Mhm. I saw her and she looked kinda\nlonely, so I struck up a conversation.
At first, she was kinda shy, but once she\nfigured out I was nice, we really hit it off.
And now we're good friends!\nWe talk about all kinds of stuff together.
Like the other day, when Angie told me\nwhat she wants to be when she grows up!
You got her to spill something like that?!
(Even I've never heard her talk about\nher dreams before...)
Angie wants to be an author.
See, Arianna is about a girl of the same\nname who goes around stopping fights\nand making everyone get along.
And after Angie read the book,\nthis is what she said:
I feel like if everyone read heartwarming\nbooks like Arianna, the world would be a \nbetter, more peaceful place.
That's why I want to write wonderful\nstories that will spread warmth, joy,\nand kindness all across the world.
Oh, Angie... What a sweet dream.\nI'd expect no less from my girl.
That's why she wants her own copy of\nArianna, so she can read it over and over.
(She's got a dream that came from talkin'\nto her friends. Looks like my granddaughter\ngrew up right under my nose.)
(I'm glad, but...it also makes me\nfeel kinda lonely.)
(Without me even bein' aware of it, my\nAngie's world has been getting bigger\nand bigger. Brings a tear to my eye.)
(But it's my duty as her grandfather to\nhelp her spread her wings and fly.)
Thanks for everything, Maribelle.\nYou be good to my Angie, you hear?
And before long, the day of Dragonyule arrived...
Angie, a present's here from\nSaint Starfall.
And he really got me a copy of Arianna!\nThank you so much, Saint Starfall!
Ain't that something? And to top it off,\nwe've got a little treat called stollen, too.\nC'mon, let's celebrate the holiday together.
(Had a heck of a time findin' the book, but\nit was pretty cheap, all things considered.)
(This is about all I can do to help\nsupport your dreams, baby girl.)
Um, Grandpa? I, um, wanted to\ntalk to you about something.
When I grow up... I want to write\nwonderful stories like this one, and fill\neveryone with warm and happy feelings.
But it's not easy to be an author, is it?
(Now that I've heard it from her, I finally\nget it. Angie's dream is still taking shape.)
(And as part of her family, my role in\nhelping her achieve it is clear!)
What makes you say that, kiddo?\nYou can do it! I know you can!
You're the nicest girl that ever did live.\nI'm a hundred percent certain you'll write\nthe best stories this world's ever seen!
Aw, thank you, Grandpa!\nY'know what? Maybe I CAN do it!
That's the spirit, love! I'll be rootin'\nfor you every step of the way.
Whatever happens, Grandpa Gauld\nwill always be watchin' over ya!
That makes me so happy. You saying\nthat is the best gift of all, Grandpa!
Dragonyule is the best day ever!
Gotta agree with you there, kiddo.\nSure am glad we came to this castle.
Now, the day's only just begun.\nLet's you and me have some fun, Angie.
